get.summary: Delete an origin access identity.
get.description: Delete an origin access identity.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The origin access identitys ID.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header you received from a previous GET      or PUT request. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.

get.summary: Delete a distribution.
get.description: Delete a distribution.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The distribution ID.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header that you received when you disabled the      distribution. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.

get.summary: Delete a streaming distribution.
get.description: Delete a streaming distribution.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The distribution ID.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header that you received when you disabled the      streaming distribution. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.

get.summary: Gets information about a specified RTMP distribution, including the distributionn      configuration.
get.description: Gets information about a specified RTMP distribution, including the distribution      configuration.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The streaming distributions ID.

get.summary: Get the configuration information about a streaming distribution.
get.description: Get the configuration information about a streaming distribution.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The streaming distributions ID.

get.summary: Lists origin access identities.
get.description: Lists origin access identities.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: Use this when paginating results to indicate where to begin in your list of origin      access identities. The results include identities in the list that occur after the marker. To      get the next page of results, set the Marker to the value of the        NextMarker from the current pages response (which is also the ID of the last      identity on that page).

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: The maximum number of origin access identities you want in the response body.

get.summary: List distributions.
get.description: List distributions.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: Use this when paginating results to indicate where to begin in your list of      distributions. The results include distributions in the list that occur after the marker. To      get the next page of results, set the Marker to the value of the        NextMarker from the current pages response (which is also the ID of the last      distribution on that page).

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: The maximum number of distributions you want in the response body.

get.summary: List the distributions that are associated with a specified AWS WAF web ACL.
get.description: List the distributions that are associated with a specified AWS WAF web ACL.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: Use Marker and MaxItems to control pagination of results. If      you have more than MaxItems distributions that satisfy the request, the response      includes a NextMarker element. To get the next page of results, submit another      request. For the value of Marker, specify the value of NextMarker      from the last response. (For the first request, omit Marker.)

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: The maximum number of distributions that you want CloudFront to return in the response body.      The maximum and default values are both 100.

parameters.name: WebACLId
parameters.description: The ID of the AWS WAF web ACL that you want to list the associated distributions.      If you specify null for the ID, the request returns a list of the distributions that arent      associated with a web ACL.

get.summary: Lists invalidation batches.
get.description: Lists invalidation batches.

parameters.name: DistributionId
parameters.description: The distributions ID.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: Use this parameter when paginating results to indicate where to begin in your list of      invalidation batches. Because the results are returned in decreasing order from most recent to      oldest, the most recent results are on the first page, the second page will contain earlier      results, and so on. To get the next page of results, set Marker to the value of      the NextMarker from the current pages response. This value is the same as the ID      of the last invalidation batch on that page.

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: The maximum number of invalidation batches that you want in the response      body.

get.summary: List streaming distributions.
get.description: List streaming distributions.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: The value that you provided for the Marker request parameter.

parameters.name: MaxItems
parameters.description: The value that you provided for the MaxItems request parameter.

get.summary: Remove tags from a CloudFront resource.
get.description: Remove tags from a CloudFront resource.

parameters.name: Resource
parameters.description: An ARN of a CloudFront resource.

get.summary: Update an origin access identity.
get.description: Update an origin access identity.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identitys id.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header that you received when retrieving the      identitys configuration. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header that you received when retrieving the      distributions configuration. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.

parameters.description: The streaming distributions id.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The value of the ETag header that you received when retrieving the      streaming distributions configuration. For example: E2QWRUHAPOMQZL.
